intro: Psychotria lubutuensis, commonly known as the Lubutu Psychotria, is a flowering plant native to the Democratic Republic of the Congo. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species known for their ornamental and medicinal value. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale green. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its restricted habitat, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
